question$: What is the correct way to define a function in Java?$
exp: The correct syntax to define a method in Java uses the void keyword.

question$: Which keyword is used to return a value from a function in Java?$
exp: The return keyword is used to pass a value back to the calling code.

question$: What is the return type of a function that does not return any value?$
exp: The void keyword indicates the method does not return any value.

question$: Which of these is a valid method name in Java?$
column8: method names can start with an underscore but not with numbers or spaces.

question$: What is the purpose of the main method in Java?$
Op2$: To start the execution of a Java program$
exp: The main method serves as the entry point for program execution.

question$: What is the default return type of the main method in Java?$
exp: The main method in Java does not return a value and uses void as its return type.

question$: How can you pass arguments to a function in Java?$
Op2$: By specifying the arguments inside parentheses when calling the function$
exp: Arguments are passed inside parentheses in Java.

Which of the following is true about method overloading?$
Op1$: Methods must have the same name and same parameters$
Op2$: Methods must have the same name but different parameters$
Op3$: Methods must have different names and the same parameters$
Op4$: Methods must have different return types$
exp: Method overloading allows multiple methods with the same name but different parameter lists.

question$: What is the keyword used to define a static method in Java?$
exp: Static methods are defined using the static keyword.
